oai_dc:dc.dc:title: To be seen at Junior Riding Club Horse Show, from the Nashville Times, 1940
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A captioned photo from the Nashville Times (1940): “An attractive annual affair is the horse show sponsored by the Junior Riding Club, that will be held Friday and Saturday nights at the Tennessee State Fair Grounds, with a special children’s show Saturday afternoon. Miss Jane Browning, president of the Junior Riding Club is seen above with Juliet Ragland’s horse, “Dr. Rhythm,” one of the many fine horses to be entered. Ed Dozier is seen at the home of his parents, Dr. and Mrs. Bate Dozier, on Gallatin Pike, riding one of the horses that the Doziers will enter in the Junior Riding Club show. Forms part of the Nashville Times newspaper collection. 1 digital photo.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Dozier family; Browning, Jane
